instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
hey there,

this board had a bit of corrosion after some cleanup was running fine. about a month later it unfortunately died, opened to inspect a hole in u9410. Now pp15v_t29 is completely short to ground, i have removed almost every component but short is still there?

would it be safe to inject voltage into that line to see what gets hot?

thanks

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message: No Title

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message: Sounds like it is shorted possibly in layers of the board. You can inject voltage and see if you can find it. When you find it, TBT is not going to be useable ever again FYI.

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message: Is that because traces blown in the pcb? how much voltage to inject?

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
i would remove Q3880, U3890 and R0960 be done with it. i think that should disable the pp15v_t29 line

if you want to find the short then just start with from small until all the way up. no more than 15v obvious. I find pouring some alcohol will help, you still start to see smoke then poke it with a tweezer while wearing glove.

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message: Yeah I agree with Alan better solution

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Alan.L, post: 43338"]i would remove Q3880, U3890 and R0960 be done with it. i think that should disable the pp15v_t29 line

if you want to find the short then just start with from small until all the way up. no more than 15v obvious. I find pouring some alcohol will help, you still start to see smoke then poke it with a tweezer while wearing glove.[/QUOTE]

thanks but after testing everything i found short where it blew. so its in the pcb layers, I scratched it back uv cured and short is gone. in this case is it best to still remove the parts you have mentioned? and im assuming u9410 will need to be replaced on the board too?

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
You don't need U9410 if thunderbolt area is damaged.
Also you can remove other chips form that area; can be reused in other repairs...

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
Hey there, i removed Q3880 and U3890 however i got nothing on R0960
I now dont have green light. ppbus is present as well as pp3v42

i will test other voltages and report back.

thanks for your help.

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
SMC_adapter_L 3.44v
pm_batlow_L 0v
pm_rsmrst_L 0v

u6900
p1: 3.49v
p4: 3.49v
p5: 3.49v

u6901
p1: 3.33v
p2: 3.33v
p4: 3.49v
p5: 3.48v

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
"pm_batlow_L 0v"
PCH will not start power on sequence this way.
Are you using original 60W charger?
Try 85W charger too.
Also see if starts in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message: no green light on 85w charger too - pch dead? possible to reflow around pch?

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
Check continuity from U6900 to the central pin of MagSafe connector.
Exact voltage for PPBUS_G3H?

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
u6900 to mid pin of magsafe is all good - nothing low
ppbus_g3h 12.56v

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
"all good - nothing low"
I told you to check continuity on that line, not resistance to ground.
Do you get 3.3V at central pin?

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
what do you mean 3.3v at central pin? u6900?
j6900??

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message: I talk about MagSafe small board; or DCIN board, how you like to name it...

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 44157"]I talk about MagSafe small board; or DCIN board, how you like to name it...[/QUOTE]

Yes. 3.3v present and continuity. not sure what happened but green light is present and fan spin too :)

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message: no chime...

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
Do you get voltage on all big coils?
Any reaction at VCORE after 2-3s?
Can you confirm USB activity?

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
missing voltage on L7550
L7510 L7520 have 0.9v

no usb activity

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
Do you get steady 0.9V from first moment, or the voltage drops from 1.1-1.2V.
L7550 is normal to have 0V with low charge on graphics.

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message: it start from 1.12v then drop to 0.9v

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
Seems that board works, if VCORE is adjusted.
Are you sure no USB activity?
Check that using OSX pendrive with Link LED; see if flashes, or not.
Disconnect internal HDD, to force USB booting.

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message: Yes usb activity is there. the problem is i got no display and chime?

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
PRAM reset done?
Did you test external video?
Disconnect internal LCD, just in case; also give it time to enter into OSX.

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message: PRAM didnt work. external is hard because now i got no thunderbolt. what is best way to get external?

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
If you are 100% sure about USB activity, then post some voltages from LCD connector.
LCD screen need to be connected when measure there.

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message: i will post lcd voltage but how come no chime? is this because from audio lines?

threads.title: 820-3115 with blown hole on u9410
threads.message:
ok so u9000 not shooting out 3.3v but it does have input of 3.3v i check p1 and lcd_igpwr missing i check resistor r1984 it has no power and measures to around 81k

so i think pch is screwed.. i also run thermal and can see pch is very hot -like 75c normally i see around 50c

reflow pch?
